intro: Humboltia tentaculata, commonly known as the California sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of California and Baja California. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant produces vibrant blue to purple flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along the coastline, thriving in salty, well-drained environments. Humboltia tentaculata is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand coastal conditions.
